wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Steven English (born 18 October 1961) is an English former professional footballer, most notably for Coventry City, Leicester City and Colchester United. Between 1979 and 1990 he made 174 appearances in the Football League, scoring 42 league goals.

response: *Tommy English (loyalist) (1960–2000), Northern Irish paramilitary and politician

response: In a surprise move, Feeley signed for First Division club Leicester City in January 1984. He had to wait until 10 March to make his debut, which came with a baptism of fire against Manchester United at Old Trafford. Feeley started in the 2–0 defeat and was brought off for Tommy English. He made two further appearances during what remained of the 1983–84 season. He established himself in the first team in the 1984–85 season, making 41 appearances and winning the club's Player of the Year award. Knee injuries reduced his appearance-count over the next two seasons and he departed the club in June 1987, after refusing a new contract. Feeley made 86 appearances during three and a half years at Filbert Street.
*Tommy English (loyalist) (1960–2000), Northern Irish activist and politician

The son of former Coventry City, Leicester City and Colchester United striker Tommy English, Tom English was initially on the books of Norwich City, joining Arsenal in the summer of 1998Youth Team Squad Page 1998-99 ArseWeb but making no first team appearances before being released in the summer of 2000.Youth Team Squad Page 1999/2000 ArseWebFlown From the Nest Profile
